issues.description: Return type and contract of Farm.singFarmSong() differ between the problem statement/template and the solution. The UML and textual description in the problem specify singFarmSong() as a method that prints the song (void). The template declares public void singFarmSong(), but the solution implements public String singFarmSong() and returns the song text instead of printing it. This mismatch can confuse students about whether they should implement printing (void) or returning a String, and may cause tests or reference code that rely on one contract to be incompatible with student implementations following the other.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the contract consistent across artifacts. Either: (A) Change the solution to match the problem and template by making singFarmSong() return void and print the song (i.e., perform System.out.println inside the method or helper), or (B) update the problem statement and template to specify that singFarmSong() returns a String (and adjust the UML/method signature accordingly). Preferation: change the solution to public void singFarmSong() (printing each verse) so the implementation matches the textual exercise description and the provided template.

issues.description: The helper method singFarmSongVerse has mismatched signature/return expectations across template and solution. In the template it is declared private void singFarmSongVerse(/*Animal animal*/) (the parameter is commented out and it currently prints parts directly). In the solution it is private String singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal) and returns the full verse as a String. This divergence affects how students should implement verse generation (printing vs returning, and whether to accept an Animal parameter) and may cause confusion when integrating singFarmSong() and the helper.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the helper's signature and behavior across artifacts. If the intended design is printing (per problem/template), change the solution helper to private void singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal) and have it print the verse lines using animal.messageOnFeed() and animal.getClass().getSimpleName(). If the intended design is returning String (as in the solution), update the template and problem statement to include an Animal parameter and indicate that the helper returns a String; also change template singFarmSong() to build and return a String. Prefer changing the solution helper to the void/printing variant to match the current problem description and starter template.
